page.title: 12HISTORY OF THE PARISH
page.content: The turbulent years of the Reformation 1540 - 1642 did not by-pass Buckhorn Weston or the surrounding area. In 1549 the ancient catholic faith was still practised in the parish church and all its services were conducted in Latin. A small Protestant party formed itself in the village and strongly objected to these ceremonies. Everyone was compelled by law to attend church at this time but this group refused to and built a meeting house of their own in opposition to the church. This was suppressed and did not come into being again until they took possession of the church in Cromwellian days.The dispossessed catholics held services inthe open air and the site called "Vespers Hollow"still recalls the event.
